title: Variable-length intake manifold
text:
In <a href="internal%20combustion%20engine">internal combustion engine</a>s, a variable-length intake manifold (VLIM),variable intake manifold (VIM), or variable intake system (VIS) is an <a href="automobile">automobile</a> internal combustion engine <a href="Inlet%20manifold">manifold</a> technology. As the name implies, VLIM/VIM/VIS can vary the length of the intake tract - in order to optimise <a href="power%20%28physics%29">power</a> and <a href="torque">torque</a> across the range of engine speed operation, as well as help provide better <a href="fuel%20efficiency">fuel efficiency</a>. This effect is often achieved by having two separate intake ports, each controlled by a valve, that open two different manifolds - one with a short path that operates at full engine load, and another with a significantly longer path that operates at lower load. The first patent issued for a variable length intake manifold was published in 1958, US Patent US2835235 by <a href="Daimler%20Benz%20AG">Daimler Benz AG</a>.
